title: Donald Trump's former top Russia adviser testifies to Congress about Ukraine scandal
text:
A Republican congressman and Trump-loyalist was booted from the House Intelligence Committee's close-door questioning of the former senior director for European and Russian Affairs on Donald Trump's National Security Council.

Matt Gaetz was seen emerging on Monday morning from the room where Fiona Hill is answering questions from the Democrat-controlled panel.

The Florida Republican said Intelligence Chairman Adam Schiff, who is heading the impeachment inquiry into Trump, told him he needed to leave because he's not on the Intelligence, Foreign Affair or Oversight Committee.

He is, however, a member of the House Judiciary Committee.

Hill, who served in her post under Trump from April 2017- August 2019, was called to Capitol Hill as the latest witness summoned in the Democratic-led impeachment inquiry against Trump.

Republican congressman and Trump loyalisst Matt Gaetz was ejected from the House Intelligence Committee's closed-door questioning of a former Trump aide Monday

The Trump loyalist said Democratic Reo. Adam Schiff (pictured) kicked him out because he's not on the Intelligence, Foreign Affairs or Oversight Committees. Gaetz is a member of the Judiciary Committee

The Trump administration's removal in May of Marie Yovanovitch as U.S. ambassador to Ukraine could figure in Hill's testimony.

On Friday, Yovanovitch testified that she had been removed based on 'unfounded and false claims' after coming under attack by Trump's personal lawyer, Rudy Giuliani, who had been working to get Ukraine to investigate Trump's political rival, Joe Biden.

Gaetz often comes to Trump's defense and even has a quote from the president praising him included in his personal Twitter account bio.

'He's a machine...handsome and going places,' Gaetz quotes Trump in the blurb.

Last week, he attempted to discredit the impeachment inquiry by invoking Trump's rhetoric when he called the Democratic hearings a 'kangaroo court.'

He was also lambasted on social media for the reference because he called Schiff 'Captain Kangaroo,' which is the title of an old children's TV show that has no links to the term 'kangaroo court,' which is often used to identify a corrupt court room.

The impeachment inquiry focuses on a July 25 phone call in which Trump asked Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to investigate former vice president Biden, a top contender for the Democratic nomination to face him in the 2020 presidential election, and Biden's businessman son Hunter Biden.

Democrats have accused Trump of pressuring a vulnerable U.S. ally to dig up dirt on a domestic rival after withholding $391 million in U.S. security aid intended to help combat Russian-backed separatists in the eastern part of Ukraine.

Fiona Hill was escorted to a committee room where she testified behind closed doors to the House Intelligence Committee Monday

Head to head: Democrat Adam Schiff chairs the House Intel Committee and has become a focus of Donald Trump's ire as he leads part of the Democrats' impeachment inquiry

Hill, who left her post during the summer, had advocated a tough U.S. approach on Moscow.

Lawmakers this week are returning from a two-week recess, with testimony from current and former administration officials on the schedule. The headline event could be testimony on Thursday from Gordon Sondland, the U.S. ambassador to the European Union.

Sondland, a political appointee and Trump political donor rather than a career diplomat, participated in a text message exchange with Bill Taylor, the top U.S. diplomat in Ukraine. Democrats say it reveals concern among aides that Trump's pressure on Ukraine to investigate Biden was improper.

Zelensky agreed to investigate, and Trump eventually allowed the aid.

Sondland is expected to be asked why he relayed from Trump to other diplomats that the president said no 'quid pro quos' connecting the Biden investigation with the U.S. aid.

Quid pro quo is a Latin term meaning a favor for a favor and is used to exhibit an exchange of good or services contingent upon completion of the other.

In this case, Democrats are insisting Trump set an illegal quid pro quo when he withheld military aid just days before his call where he urged Zelesnky to probe the Bidens.

Trump has denied wrongdoing – still the inquiry could prompt the House to approve formal articles of impeachment charges, which would lead to a trial in the Senate that would either clear the president or remove him from office.

The Senate is led by Trump's fellow Republicans, who have shown little inclination to remove him.

The Intelligence Committee also is scheduled to hear from Deputy Assistant Secretary of State George Kent and State Department Counselor Ulrich Brechbuhl, a top aide to Secretary of State Mike Pompeo.

As talks continue over whether the whistleblower from within the U.S. intelligence community who prompted the inquiry will testify, Trump weighed in on Twitter, demanding that the person testify and that their identity be revealed.

Scathing statement: Marie Yovanovitch, who Trump fired as ambassador to Ukraine in May, told lawmakers she was pushed out because of a whispering campaign against her

Center of the affair: Hunter Biden will break his silence on Tuesday by speaking to ABC's Good Morning America, the first time he has been seen and heard from since July

Trump has questioned the patriotism of the whistleblower, who filed a complaint after the Zelensky call saying Trump was improperly using the power of his office to solicit interference in the 2020 election from a foreign country.

Lawmakers also may debate whether to seek to compel testimony from Giuliani. On Thursday, two Giuliani associates - Ukraine-born Lev Parnas and Belarus-born Igor Fruman - who helped him with his efforts to investigate the Bidens, were charged with scheming to violate U.S. campaign finance laws.

Giuliani has defended his actions as proper in his role as Trump's lawyer.

A source familiar with the probe said federal investigators, including Manhattan prosecutors, are 'examining Giuliani's interactions' with Parnas and Furman.

Giuliani disputed that, saying he would have expected to have heard from prosecutors.

'I think the probe is a malicious rumor,' Giuliani told Reuters.

Giuliani already has a subpoena from the Intelligence Committee demanding that he produce documents related to Ukraine by Tuesday. He has not said whether he will comply.
description: Fiona Hill quit as Trump's adviser on Russia and Ukraine this summer and testified behind closed doors to Adam Schiff's House Intelligence Committee about the unfolding scandal.
